sentences: Kaart ei jookse, mis sa klibudega mängid!
Nähes esimest mõndakümmend vaenlast mööda traavivat, hüüdis Ott põlglikult: "Puha klibu!"
context: The word 'mängid' is the first person singular present form of the verb 'mängima', which means 'to play'. In this context, it appears in the phrase 'klibudega mängid', which translates to 'playing/messing around with pebbles/gravel'. The dictionary definition shows that 'klibu' refers to small stones or gravel, and when combined with 'mängid', it suggests someone is playing with or foolishly dealing with something insignificant.
